title: Succession, season 2 finale recap: A Tour de Force of yacht-based back-stabbing and dysfunctional family psychodrama
text:
Phew. In the words of Kendall Roy (Jeremy Strong), I need a straightener. The finale of Shakespearean dramedy Succession’s breakout second season was a tour de force of yacht-based back-stabbing and dysfunctional family psychodrama, with a killer twist in the tail.

Here’s your forensic recap and all the talking points from an epic 10th and final episode, titled “This Is Not For Tears” - a quote from John Berryman poem “Dream Song 29”, literary reference fans.

Greg refused to toe the line

We opened this incendiary finale on a relatively quiet note, as terrified Cousin Greg (Nicholas Braun) gave testimony to the congressional hearing into historical wrong-doing and document destruction at Waystar...
